subject: Education
title: Curiosity: The Brain's Built-In Reward
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Curiosity: The Brain's Built-In Reward.

hook.text: People chose to receive electric shocks rather than not knowing what was behind a door.

buildup.text: Curiosity activates the brain's dopamine reward circuit, the same one triggered by food.

discovery.text: Gruber showed that curious states improve memory even for unrelated information presented nearby.

twist.text: Curiosity can't be forced‚Äîbut information gaps and surprising facts reliably trigger it.

climax.text: Opening a question before giving the answer primes the brain to absorb more.

punchline.text: Curiosity doesn't just want answers‚Äîit makes them stick.
